_header: Our Father in heaven I-hallowed be Thy name
_description: The Pater Noster in five couplets

CamEmm27.First Lines:
Vre fader in heuene yhalȝed be þy nameÞy kynedom to
                    us mote come fore þar is blisse and game…
CamEmm27.Last Lines:
…Led us neuere Louerd into no fondingeac Lus us vt of vuele
                    and ȝif us þy blessinge
CamEmm27.Note: Ends, ‘Amen id est so mote hit boe’.
CamEmm27.Editions:
Person,  Henry Axel. 
             Cambridge Middle English Lyrics.
         Seattle: University of Washington Press, 1953; rev. ed. 1962: 27.

             “The Petitions of the Paternoster in Medieval English

             Medium Ævum
         27 (1958): 8-16: 10.
